text: In the avatar, the Enzyte man displays the size and rigidity of his member. It shocks these Sailor Scouts.

text: I'm a year late, but she's there because she was there in the original commercial, and the sailor scouts are just added on.

text: People have long since stopped counting (420, btw) but I love the comment/avatar synergy. Phillipe could be playing a mean game of poker right now.

text: This was a triumph.

text: you are welcome for the 121st chubby. there you go.

name: snowman
text: You know, I was thinking that too.  Not only that, but it's funny how everyone has documented the number of chubbies as it climbs.  I get it.  I get that if there are now 277 chubbies, there would have been, at one time, 276, 275, 119, 47, et cetera...

name: i_love_kate
text: My faith in humanity has actually been shaken by the fact that such a comment could garner three genuine lames from three, seperate, real people.

name: stuart
text: Maybe it's when you get right down to it this is one of the Seven Unforgivable Assetbar Tropes (I SAY THIS ALL THE TIME NOW)

text: IT IS DONE.

name: mashisoyo
text: Is this the most chubbied post? I ask out of genuine curiousity.

name: rowboat
text: Two plus years later, I still say that it fucking better not be. That would be an insult to all the really genius shit that has gone on here.

name: pascal
text: Let's be honest, when you have a mustache like that, you might as well just let it all ride on the first impression.

name: mr_pete
text: When people want to know what "Faulkneresque dread" is, I point them to this strip.

name: shmuckeles
text: it that what that is

name: spinynorman
text: I get the feeling Nice Pete's brain sounds a lot like Judge Holden from Blood Meridian.

name: korukyu
text: I am suddenly far more amused than I was before I read this comment. A chubby to you for making me laugh awkwardly and uncomfortably.

name: spinynorman
text: It's what I do.

name: scramblesthedog
text: This strip is actually more interesting now that we know what Pat's actual answer to that question is.

name: wae
text: are there other early hints at Pat's persuasion?

name: hollis
text: There's his hatred of Arthur and Mr. Gary - homophobia as self-defense?

name: thesyndicate88
text: The only problem is that Pat isn't gay yet. Remember, he TURNS gay as the result of a family curse.

name: postblank
text:
Well at the time of that arc, Simon mentions that the birthday in question was three years prior to said arc.

http://achewood.com/index.php?date=08112006

text: Thank you!

name: rogergs
text: The careful reader will see that the strip is fairly larded with jabs at Pat's defensive prissiness, which now can be read as foreshadowing.

text: Best character introduction ever.

name: saurkraus
text: Heck yes! :)

text:
Where is the retardo post on this one? Is he dead?

Please say he's dead.

text: This is exactly how I imagine going to prison for a serious crime would turn out for me.

text: best opening line ever

text: When I encounter a smug dude with a smoking hot girl I go to great pains to overtly stare at the dude's package and pretend that the girl doesn't exist. As a straight guy I find this empowering ...

name: thalassocrat
text: In my mind, Pete has the voice of Mr Rogers. I can't help it.

name: norrin
text: In my mind he has kind of a regular, rough voice, but he speaks in a very calm tone. Until he freaks out, of course.

name: ovenface
text: I imagine him as having a slighty melodic, high and airy voice. I agree with the calm tone though.

text: oh man there goes my childhood THANKS

name: achilleselbow
text: Just to clear up any confusion, Nice Pete is not gay. He merely finds the very idea of women revolting and understands male friendship in much the same way that the ancient Greeks did.

text: Forrest Gump is always worth a chubby.

Dude what the fuuuuck.

This is like coming seeing someone wearing your same shirt in a train so that you can't get away from one another.

name: carlyle
text: I said this about Chucklebot but I am saying it this time and I AM MEANING IT: This strip introduces my least favorite character of all time of any comic strip.

name: origotoshi
text: Why don't you like that jail guard?

name: carlyle
text: Just every god damned thing about him. I look at him and I'm like, "Jesus. Why did Onstad even waste time drawing you? You weren't worth the finger strength."

name: enough_talk
text: How about the sublte dissolution of the justice/judiciary/penal system. One panel in. Anyone?

text:
i feel like there should've been a panel of silence before Pete says anything.

still, Onstad def knew exactly what this caracter was going to be before he appeared.

name: woodenteeth
text:
Considering the most recent comic (i.e. Nice Pete driving around a trapped Teodor and Nathan the elderly homosexual), this is almost foreshadowing.

Also, Pat now likes the penis.

name: dusty
text: I just clicked random from that and got the one where beef talks ray into sparing Pete (chess/whack a mole) then again and got this one. It's like assetbar is giving me a nice Pete Review. It's two distinctly different kinds of creepy in one. On top of that, I've been sitting still long enough that the automatic lights shut off, and I just now learned that taco bell has plans to start selling actual tacos. Were through the looking glass here people. Or at least I am.

name: woodenteeth
text: Is there broken glass and blood on the other side?

name: bixschmix
text: Glass and blood and tacos. Open late for Fourthmeal!

name: inhmn
text: the beginning of a beautiful friendship :D
